# Objective

Use window functions (in SQL or dplyr) to calculate the year-to-date average and the six-day moving averages for each item.

# Approach

### Dataset description

For this analysis, I have stock prices for Tesla, Amazon, Apple, and Microsoft. These stock receive significant attention because of its high volatility, rapid growth history, and leadership in technology. I selected the these Stock Price Historical Dataset (Jan 1, 2022â€“ Feb 12, 2026) from Kaggle because it satisfies all the assignment requirements and provides meaningful time-series financial data suitable for window function analysis. Here are the column description for this dataset:

-   Name: Company name / ticker symbol
-   Date: Trading date
-   Close: Closing price for the date

### Anticipated Challenges

The main anticipated challenges include data cleaning, handling non-trading days, correct year-based partitioning for YTD calculations, defining proper window frames for six-day moving averages. Additionally, volatility and performance considerations may impact analysis accuracy and efficiency.
